thread.title: Mark Dantonio dodges South Carolina question, looks to U-M
thread.title_full: Mark Dantonio dodges South Carolina question, looks to U-M

title: Mark Dantonio dodges South Carolina question, looks to U-M
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Mark Dantonio dodges South Carolina question, looks to U-M EAST LANSING -- "We're here to talk about Michigan," Mark Dantonio said today when asked about the South Carolina job, vacated with Steve Spurrier retiring. Check out this story on lansingstatejournal.com: http://on.lsj.com/1LssxXI Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 1 To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Mark Dantonio dodges South Carolina question, looks to U-M Joe Rexrode, Detroit Free Press 12:21 p.m. EDT October 13, 2015 Michigan State Spartans head coach Mark Dantonio stands on the field between plays during the 1st quarter of a game at Spartan Stadium. (Photo: Mike Carter-USA TODAY Sports) 
EAST LANSING -- "We're here to talk about Michigan," Mark Dantonio said today when asked about the South Carolina job, vacated with Steve Spurrier retiring. 
Dantonio also mentioned that South Carolina is his alma mater, and he did nothing to end speculation that has already started in terms of preliminary wish lists for the job. So that can keep percolating as the No. 7 Spartans (6-0, 2-0 Big Ten) prepare for the biggest game of the season to date, Saturday at No. 12 Michigan (5-1, 2-0). 
As usual, Dantonio gave no injury updates, but when asked if Jack Allen might not play after suffering an ankle injury against Rutgers, he said: "There's always a chance." 
"Always a chance he will play," Dantonio added, his only mention of any of MSU's injured players. MSU quarterback Connor Cook said after Saturday's 31-24 win at Rutgers that MSU expects left tackle Jack Conklin (knee) and tight end Josiah Price (ankle) to play. Harbaugh's first game vs. MSU ended with a broken arm 
Dantonio praised Michigan and its swarming defense and "old school" running attack under first-year coach Jim Harbaugh, and he said of the Spartans at the midway point: "What you know about Michigan State is we'll hang in there and we'll hang tough and we'll play through some pain. ... Are we perfect? No. Do we have some playmakers? Yes." Read or Share this story: http://on.lsj.com/1LssxXI TOP VIDEOS
